Stabilkan Harga Garam, Edhy Prabowo Genjot Program Geomembrane
05 Nov 2019, 10:54 by Dias Prasongko, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan (KKP) Edhy Prabowo mengatakan bakal mengenjot program geomembrane sebagai bagian untuk menstabilkan harga garam lokal. Program ini diharapkan juga bisa meningkatkan produksi sekaligus kualitas garam di tingkat petani atau petambak.
"KKP sendiri akan meningkatkan kualitas dengan geomembrane dan program pugarnya. Ahamdulillah dari 7 ribu lahan yang sudah kami lakukan, telah menghasilkan produksi yang luar biasa," kata Edhy usai mengikuti rapat di Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Menurut Edhy Prabowo, langkah ini terus ditempuh untuk mengurangi dampak dari harga garam yang terus jatuh di tingkat petani/petambak. Adapun KKP mencatat, saat ini di Tanah Air ada lebih dari 19 ribu orang petambak atau petani garam dengan total lahan mencapai 27 ribu hektare.
Edhy juga menyinggung bahwa pemerintah akan segera menyusun rencana penyerapan garam milik petani/petambak. Langkah ini ditempuh, untuk mencegah harga garam produksi petani/petambak yang terus jatuh.
Selain itu, kata Edhy, KKP juga terus mendorong produksi garam untuk kebutuhan industri aneka pangan dan industri yakni chlor alkali plan (soda kostik). Saat ini pemerintah telah memiliki 4-6 hektare lahan yang digunakan sebagai proyek rintisan produksi garam jenis ini dari total 400 hetare lahan.
Edhy melanjutkan, perbaikan tata niaga garam juga akan ditingkatkan dengan terus mempererat koordinasi baik antar kementerian maupun dengan produsen maupun industri. Dia mengatakan, hal ini juga telah menjadi kesepakatan bersama usai gelaran rapat di Kementerian Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian.
"KKP akan cari jalan keluar, turun bareng bersama dengan Kementerian Perindustrian dan Kementerian Perdagangan. Kami sudah memetakan (masalah garam) dan ini jadi kewajiban bersama," ujar Edhy, yang juga politikus Partai Gerindra ini.

Stabilizing Salt Prices, Edhy Prabowo Boosts the Geomembrane Program
05 Nov 2019, 10:54 by Dias Prasongko, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) Edhy Prabowo said he would boost the geomembrane program as part of stabilizing local salt prices. The program is expected to also be able to increase production and quality of salt at the farm or farm level.
"The CTF itself will improve quality with its geomembrane and lighting programs. Thank God, from the 7 thousand land we have done, it has produced extraordinary production," Edhy said after attending a meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Central Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
According to Edhy Prabowo, this step continues to be taken to reduce the impact of falling salt prices at the farmer / farmer level. As for the CTF, there are currently more than 19 thousand farmers or salt farmers with a total land area of 27 thousand hectares.
Edhy also mentioned that the government would immediately draw up a plan to absorb salt owned by farmers / farmers. This step was taken, to prevent the price of salt produced by farmers / farmers that continue to fall.
In addition, said Edhy, the CTF also continues to encourage the production of salt for the needs of various food industries and industries namely chlor alkali plan (cosmetics soda). The government currently has 4-6 hectares of land used as a pilot project for the production of this type of salt from a total of 400 hectares of land.
Edhy continued, the improvement of the salt trade system would also be improved by continuing to strengthen coordination between ministries and with producers and industry. He said, this had also become a joint agreement after the mat of the meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs.
"KKP will find a way out, come together with the Ministry of Industry and the Ministry of Trade. We have mapped (the salt problem) and this is a joint obligation," said Edhy, who is also a Gerindra Party politician.
